author: Falyn Stempler
title: Donald Trump confirms he may try to privatize the US Postal Service
text:
Donald Trump confirms he may try to privatize the US Postal Service
The President-elect is reportedly eager to privatize the public service after quarrelling with the mail agency during his first term.
President-elect Donald Trump [confirm](https://x.com/JStein_WaPo/status/1868708085034107198)e[d](https://x.com/JStein_WaPo/status/1868708085034107198) Monday that he is considering privatizing the U.S. Postal Service.
Trump has discussed [remodeling the mail agency](/news/politics/144151/what-is-project-2025-initiative) with commerce secretary pick Howard Lutnick, who is co-chairing his presidential transition, three sources with direct knowledge told [The Washington Post](https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2024/12/14/trump-usps-privatize-plan/).
Hundreds of thousands of federal workers' jobs could be at risk if Trump's mail agency overhaul comes to fruition.
[Tsunami warning for French Riviera town which could disappear under the sea](/news/world-news/157706/tsunami-warning-french-riviera-town)[Origin of mystery drones revealed by UFO expert as he warns of 'security threat'](/news/us-news/157509/New-Jersey-drones-latest-Russia)
The move would also likely have a major impact on consumer shipping and business supply chains.
After discussing the matter earlier in the month with a group of transition officials, Trump reportedly expressed a desire to cut government funding to the organization for financial reasons.
Trump's exact plans, similar to other sweeping changes he vowed to enact during his campaign such as [his mass deportation operation](/news/politics/155336/trump-mass-deportation-billion-dollar-cost), are not immediately clear.
In 2019, then-President Trump quarreled with the mail agency over disagreements about financial and business decisions.
Trump reportedly wanted to exert more control over setting rates, choosing staff and managing client relations, among other things.

Regarding mass deportation, the Pentagon has refused to comment on the subject at press time.
However, officials who spoke on the condition of anonymity have expressed concern about legal and logistical problems with the potential plan.
Yet, authoritative bodies including Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) already [appear to be gearing up](/news/politics/156728/donald-trump-deportation-plan-private-equity-profit) for a plan to be set in motion.
Additionally, watchdog bodies warn that [private equity firms may seize the opportunity](/news/politics/156728/donald-trump-deportation-plan-private-equity-profit) to get involved in the business of detention and deportation and stand to make a massive sum.
